title: Planning for Sustainable Ocean Use in Antarctica Under Global Environmental Change
descriptions:
Title: Planning for Sustainable Ocean Use in Antarctica Under Global Environmental Change (PLAnT)

Abstract:

The Antarctic Ocean is facing unprecedented environmental change, necessitating urgent action to ensure sustainable use and conservation of its resources. The proposed project, PLAnT, aims to develop an integrated, sustainable Marine Spatial Planning (MSP) framework for Antarctica, addressing the critical need for effective management of the region's rapidly changing ecosystem.

PLAnT will assess social-ecological vulnerabilities, construct future scenarios, and support area-based climate action, providing dynamic solutions to the challenges posed by climate change. Through comprehensive governance analyses and stakeholder engagement, the project will foster a paradigm shift towards sustainability and equity in Antarctic ocean management.

Addressing the unique contextual idiosyncrasies of Antarctica, PLAnT will develop tailored solutions to mitigate the risks associated with the region's complex political, social, and economic landscape. By informing and inspiring nations to adopt sustainable ocean management practices, the project has the potential for significant global impact, aligning with key international agendas on ocean sustainability and conservation. Its success will contribute to a more resilient and equitable future for the Antarctic Ocean and the global community.
